abstract.text: Refresh a non-expired token instead of sending a new login request.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The system sends a refresh request instead of a login request when a token hasn’t expired yet and the
is set. The refresh request also sends a server nonce request before it begins.

A refresh request uses the previous refresh token to request a new token without prompting the user for credentials. The system attempts it when the existing token hasn’t expired and the time since the last full login hasn’t exceeded the
in the Device Management profile. It doesn’t apply to User Secure Enclave key authentication, because the user isn’t prompted for credentials.
The refresh request is a JSON Object Signing and Encryption object (JOSE) object that’s formatted per RFC 7519 and signed with the
and
per RFC 7515. Processing the refresh network request and response is the same as for a JSON Web Encryption (JWE) login response. For more information, see
The following table specifies the header parameters that the system uses to create a refresh request:
Key
Value
Notes
Required.
Required. The signing algorithm. Only ES256 is supported.
The base-64 encoded SHA256 hash of the ANSI X9.63 formatted public key for the signing identity
Required.
The base-64 encoded device signing certificate from
Optional. If the certificate is set, the system includes it here. The value is base-64 encoded per RFC 7517.
Optional. If present, adds key value pairs to the JWT.

Required. The system uses the values in the dictionary to encrypt the response.

abstract.text: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.
A set of extra scopes to add to the base for the authentication request.
The identifier for the client at the identity provider.
The name of the claim to include in authentication requests.
The token endpoint URL for login requests.
Saves the provided certificate for the key type.
Use a system-supported method to authenticate with an identity provider.
Create an encrypted login response and configure the concatenation key derivation function (Concat KDF).

abstract.text: Request an embedded assertion for login types that require a digital signature for authentication.
Request an encrypted embedded assertion for login types that require password encryption.
Create a signed JOSE login request.

abstract.text: Create a WS-Trust login request using the metadata exchange data (MEX) response.
Use credentials from macOS login to perform single sign-on with an identity provider.
Support the platform SSO 2.0 protocol for encryption and decryption operations.
